text: Well this is the business end of the game. At that stage you can get a move because a horse is sweating up or misbehaving going into the stalls. Manual traders piling on because of it, or piling on following a steam or a drift. There are a multitude of things that can result in such movements. Don't forget that closer to the off you get, the more manual traders are looking to exit positions too.

elements.text: Well this is the business end of the game. At that stage you can get a move because a horse is sweating up or misbehaving going into the stalls. Manual traders piling on because of it, or piling on following a steam or a drift. There are a multitude of things that can result in such movements. Don't forget that closer to the off you get, the more manual traders are looking to exit positions too.

text: People are aware that shit happens just before a horse race right? I mean it's not just an information vacuum until suddenly the race starts. The horses walk around, they act up, they look better or worse than people expected. That stuff moves the prices in ways that can eclipse the influence of any market participant. Not to mention that close to the off is when all the market's main actors get involved. No one person can dominate the market - if they did who would they bet against? It's not smart to ascribe simple explanations to complex events just because the narrative is appealing.

elements.text: People are aware that shit happens just before a horse race right? I mean it's not just an information vacuum until suddenly the race starts. The horses walk around, they act up, they look better or worse than people expected. That stuff moves the prices in ways that can eclipse the influence of any market participant. Not to mention that close to the off is when all the market's main actors get involved. No one person can dominate the market - if they did who would they bet against? It's not smart to ascribe simple explanations to complex events just because the narrative is appealing.
